mcq: Who first introduced the term machine learning in 1959?
options: a: Donald Hebb | b: Raytheon Company | c: Tom M. Mitchell | d: Arthur Samuel

mcq: What was the name of the experimental 'learning machine' with punched tape memory?
options: a: Cybertron | b: Nilsson's book | c: Duda and Hart | d: Walter Pitts

mcq: Who provided a formal definition of the algorithms studied in the field of machine learning?
options: a: Alan Turing | b: Warren McCulloch | c: Raytheon Company | d: Tom M. Mitchell

mcq: What is one of the main objectives of modern-day machine learning?
options: a: To invent new algorithms | b: To classify data based on developed models | c: To study human cognitive systems | d: To analyze sonar signals

mcq: What did Alan Turing propose in his paper 'Computing Machinery and Intelligence'?
options: a: Can machines think? | b: Can machines do what we can do? | c: Can machines learn from experience? | d: Can machines recognize patterns?
